Node.definition: = state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
literally: name; hence: = the information that is generally known about a person or deity, which may either be good or bad and has a direct impact on the way this person or deity is regarded

= high quality oil (שֶׁמֶן) ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= process by which humans or animals stop living

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= process by which females among humans or animals give birth to offspring through the process of conception, pregnancy, and labor; ≈ sometimes associated with painful toil and anxiety
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= a state of grief, caused by bereavement, loss, or other difficult circumstances, and which is shown by one's actions
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
literally: drinking; hence: = a banquet meal or feast with honored guests
= a linker introducing a proposition denoting the reason for what precedes
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

= state in which humans and deities are alive and well, ◄ which, for humans, requires the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= state in which human experience displeasure, which is said to reside in their heart (לֵב) ◄ and is caused by their own condition or by someone else

= action by which humans give expression to a friendly attitude, joy and amusement with the gestures and sounds that normally accompany it; ≈ this is normally regarded as a good thing, especially when done with restraint, whereas a lack of restraint is often associated with foolishness
literally: badness of face; hence: = state in which humans experience an emotion of sadness, often visible in their facial expression
literally: (one's) heart is good; hence: = state in which humans feel happy and contented
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= a state of grief, caused by bereavement, loss, or other difficult circumstances, and which is shown by one's actions
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= state in which humans feel and show great joy
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= action by which humans or deities speak to animals, humans, deities, or natural objects in anger, in order to express their displeasure and cause them to change their behavior
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

exact meaning unsure: = thorny plant, ◄ possibly Sarcopoterium spinosum or Thorny or Spiny Burnet; ► known for making a crackling sound when burning, for overgrowing an entire building when no longer in use, and for being so entangled that they are impenetrable
= a rounded container ◄ usually made of ceramic or metal ► used for storage or cooking

= action by which humans give expression to a friendly attitude, joy and amusement with the gestures and sounds that normally accompany it; ≈ this is normally regarded as a good thing, especially when done with restraint, whereas a lack of restraint is often associated with foolishness

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= state in which a condition does not serve any purpose
= causative action by which deities or humans cause (other) humans to either become fools or look like fools
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

Node.gloss: to destroy|to corrupt|to put an end
Node.definition: = action by which someone brings an event to an end, usually under unfavorable circumstances

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= object given to someone else
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= pertaining to being the last part of an event, close to its moment of completion
= point in time at which an event starts happening
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
literally: long of nostrils, long of breath; hence: = pertaining to not being given to anger
= inner person of a human or celestial being, associated with emotions, such as joy, grief, worry, courage, anger, willingness, etc.
= state in which humans or deities have an elevated status, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified
= inner person of a human or celestial being, associated with emotions, such as joy, grief, worry, courage, anger, willingness, etc.

Node.gloss: to be quick|to be hasty|to be rash|sudden
Node.definition: = action by which humans or divine beings act quickly
= inner person of a human or celestial being, associated with emotions, such as joy, grief, worry, courage, anger, willingness, etc.

Node.gloss: to be, become vexed|to be, become angry
Node.definition: = state/process by which humans or deities experience displeasure; ◄ caused by someone else's condition or behavior
= state in which human experience displeasure, which is said to reside in their heart (לֵב) ◄ and is caused by their own condition or by someone else
literally: bosom; hence: = the inner person, which includes the center of human thinking, and the seat of emotions

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= state in which a countable entity is the first or the previous in a range
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= something that is of benefit; often used in rhetorical questions suggesting that nothing is of benefit at all in a certain situation

Node.gloss: to see the sun > to live
Node.definition: literally: to see the sub; hence: = state in which humans are alive
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins
= something that is of benefit to humans; often used in rhetorical questions suggesting that nothing is of benefit at all in a certain situation
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

Node.gloss: to keep alive|to restore to life
Node.definition: = to cause an object to become or remain alive and well; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in most cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= person engaged in a certain activity

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible

Node.gloss: to make straight (what God has made crooked)
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans cause an object to extend uniformly in one direction only, without a curve or bend

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= causative action by which someone causes something to be bent or twisted out of shape or position

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= state of hardship or difficulty in a circumstance, sometimes as the consequence of wicked behavior

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

Node.gloss: the cause of|with regard to|because of|in order that
Node.definition: = particle linking two propositions, denoting a causal relation between the two
literally: to find (in someone); hence: = process by which humans come upon certain information
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= particle linking two elements and indicating that X takes place after Y has ceased existing or has been completed
= a reference to any event

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= state in which a condition does not serve any purpose
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

Node.gloss: to vanish|to disappear|to be lost|to perish|to be broken|to be destroyed|to be ruined
Node.definition: = process by which humans or objects disappear or are removed from existence;◄ either by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, natural processes, acts of destruction, or direct divine intervention

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness

Node.gloss: to prolong (days) > to stay long|to linger|to last|to live on
Node.definition: literally: to prolong (days); hence: = to stay (in a certain location or position) for an extended period of time
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong, resulting in a state of guilt and, eventually, hardship and suffering
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= action by which humans act in accordance to a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= state in which an event is performed to a larger extent than is normally done
= action by which humans or deities act in a way that is contrary to (God's) law, ► resulting in a state of guilt
= behavior of a person without good sense or wisdom
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression
= a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes

Node.gloss: to hold on (to a type of behavior)
Node.definition: literally: to hold on to a quality as if it were a person; hence: = to act in accordance with a certain quality

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event
= state in which humans experience fear
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
literally: to go out (from a circumstance); hence: = process by which humans are no longer affected by a certain circumstance

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether or not on purpose, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= a linker indicating that one proposition is the purpose or result or another

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

= actions by which humans or deities consign other humans or deities or inanimate objects to death, damage, or destruction, usually by invoking the name of a deity if the agent is human; ◄ this is done as punishment, out of contempt, fear, anger, or hostility, or because one was paid to do so; ► the effectiveness of a curse partially depends on the authority of the one pronouncing it

Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency

= pertaining to being different from other objects and events that are in the same range

= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

Node.gloss: to turn (one's) heart|to put (one's) mind (on something else)
Node.definition: literally: to turn (one's) heart; hence: = action by which humans decide to focus their thinking on something else
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

literally: to spy out; hence: = action by which humans increase their knowledge by processing a large quantity of information

= state in which humans lack wisdom,◄ possibly due to overconfidence, ► which can manifest itself, among other things, in relying on wealth rather than on God
= behavior which lack good sense
= state in which an action is regarded as abnormal and associated with people who are insane

= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
literally: bitter; hence: = state in which humans have a character that causes other humans to be in deep distress
= process by which humans or animals stop living

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine

= combination of two or three nets in layers, usually a small mesh inner net sandwiched between two nets of looser mesh; ► set out vertically in the water, held in place by floats on the surface of the water and weighted down by a single weighted rope at the bottom; left in place for several hours to give time for fish to accumulate in it; ≈ associated with aggression and control

= long net hanging vertically in the water with floats at the upper edge and weights at the lower edge; ► drawn in by men working in boats or from shore; as the ends are drawn together to the boat or drawn ashore, fish are trapped in the area enclosed by the net; drawn in immediately after it has been spread out; ≈ associated with aggression and control
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= material used to tie objects together or to tie animals or humans; ≈ associated with power and control over something or someone else

= the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals
= state in which humans and deities have character, integrity, and good fortune
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether or not on purpose, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= action by which humans or animals take control of (other) humans, animals, towns or land, usually with violence

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
literally: to find (in someone); hence: = process by which humans come upon certain information

= state in which humans experience the desire to attain a certain status or condition and do what is needed to make this a reality

= process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

= pertaining to being a thousand in number or to happening a thousand times
